content:
Great to hear that you're practicing regularly and making progress with your ukulele playing! D-tuning is a fantastic tuning to explore, and I'd be happy to recommend some songs that use it.

Before I dive into song recommendations, I just want to clarify that D-tuning on a ukulele typically refers to the tuning DADF#AD, which is different from the standard GCEA tuning. If you're using a different variation of D-tuning, please let me know and I'll try to provide more tailored suggestions.

Assuming you're using the DADF#AD tuning, here are some songs that you might enjoy playing:

1. **"Ho Hey" by The Lumineers**: This catchy folk-rock tune is a great fit for D-tuning, and its simple chord progression makes it easy to play.
2. **"Skinny Love" by Bon Iver**: This hauntingly beautiful song uses a combination of fingerpicking and strumming, which will help you develop your technique.
3. **"Wagon Wheel" by Old Crow Medicine Show**: This country-folk classic is a great choice for D-tuning, with a simple, repetitive chord progression that's easy to follow.
4. **"Fast Car" by Tracy Chapman**: This iconic song has a beautiful, soulful quality that suits the deeper tones of D-tuning. You can focus on fingerpicking and singing to bring out the emotional depth of the song.
5. **"Home" by Edward Sharpe & The Magnetic Zeros**: This upbeat indie-folk song features a catchy, bouncy rhythm that's perfect for D-tuning.
6. **"First Day of My Life" by Bright Eyes**: This sweet, acoustic ballad is a great choice for practicing fingerpicking and singing in D-tuning.

Remember to always practice with a metronome to improve your timing, and don't be afraid to experiment with different strumming patterns and fingerpicking techniques to add your own flair to these songs. Good luck, and most importantly, have fun!
